alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Southwest Mountains; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued December 13 at 1:29PM MST until December 15 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Southwest to west winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. However, gusts up to 70 mph will be possible above 8000 feet. * WHERE...Western Mountains, and Jemez Mountains. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles on north to south oriented roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow and areas of blowing snow will cause reduced visibility as well. Greatest impacts are expected near the Continental Divide along I-40.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Southwest Mountains; West Central Mountains
